result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon F Meeler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees during the period of probation. 
If revoked, defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison wages. Balance due prior to the end of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
*Restitution set at zero.

If able, maintain part time employment.
Obtain GED/HSED.

Defendant required to provide a biological specimen DNA to the State Crime Lab for testing.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms/body armor/weapons.
Defendasnt can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Mental health assessment. Follow up care and treatment at the Mental Health Unit. Take all prescribed medications by treating physicians.

No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
No contact with victim Blanche K.
AODA assessment and follow up care treatment.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leon F Meeler in court with Attorney Crystal L Saltzwadel.  Defendant Leon F Meeler in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense counsel and the State are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.  Court holds colloquy with defendant.  Defendant waives his right to a hearing.
There being no challenge to the report by the parties, the Court found the defendant competent to proceed and ordered the proceedings reinstated.

Defendant's VOP hold remains.  Case will be transferred back to the Administrative Law Judge.  No further adjournment to Branch 28 at this time.
Clerk:  jms

from Jenna Niess, Psy.D., dated June 10, 2016 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Court notified by Forensics of language required on Order for Competency Examination.
Amended Order signed by the Court and filed - copy forwarded to Forensics.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Crystal L Saltzwadel in court, defendant Leon F Meeler not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp, appearing for Michael Lonski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews letter received from Administrative Law Judge raising the issue of competency.

Court orders revocation proceedings suspended and defendant to be evaluated as to competency.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services signed by the Court and filed.
Court orders case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. jbs
Request for a competency examination from the Division of Hearings and Appeals.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, with credit for 163 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  

The Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.

The Court IMPOSED AND STAYED this sentence and placed the Defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AND TO PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPRVISION:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees during the period of probation. If revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison wages with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  If able, maintain part time employment.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Obtain GED/HSED.
*  Mental Health assessment and follow up care and treatment at the Mental Health Unit.
*  Take all prescribed medications by treating physicians.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  No contact with the victim Blanche K.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms / body armor / weapons.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Leon F Meeler in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Leon F Meeler not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney in trial in another Court.  Matter rescheduled for a projected guilty plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Court sets bail at $1,000.00 cash TOT Justice Point with the following conditions:  Drug testing; absolute sobriety; no possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription; no firearms/dangerous weapons; mental health monitoring; no contact with Blanche  K;
Original information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant Leon F Meeler in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Leon F Meeler in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Competency hearing proceeded.  Defendant does not contest the findings of the recent doctor's report.  Court reinstates proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Report from Dr. Laurence Trueman received and filed.
Order To Produce Transport

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Leon F Meeler not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Defense reports that the defendant wishes to challenge report of Dr. Trueman.  Defendant to be produced for hearing; doctor to appear via video conferencing.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Leon F Meeler not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Review Hearing.  Parties in receipt of Department of Health Services report dated 5-04-15.  Defense requests time to review report with the defendant to determine if defense to challenge said report.  Status conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency), signed and filed.

Defendant Leon F Meeler in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Leon F Meeler in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Doctor's Report Return.  Hearing proceeded.  Parties in receipt of report dated 1-23-15 authored by Brooke E. Lundbohm, Psy.D. opining the defendant not competent to proceed at this time.  Defendant not challenging findings contained within said report.  The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services(DHS).  The Court finds that involuntary administration of medication and treatment is necessary (see order for specifics).  The defendant given 31 days of credit.  The Court orders defendant REMANDED into the custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for turn over to DHS.  Case set for Review Hearing on 5-06-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Leon F Meeler not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel requests additional time to review report with defendant.  No objection from the state. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Report dated 1-23-15 authored by Brooke E. Lundbohm, Psy.D, received and filed.

Defendant Leon F Meeler in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Leon F Meeler in custody.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  COURT EXTEND THE TIME LIMITS FOR THE PRELIMINARY HEARING.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
